citations.narrative:
The double yellow-headed Amazon was killed since the last inspection on January 25, 2024. The facility representative
stated that the Amazon was predated upon by a racoon through the enclosure wall or ceiling. The primary outdoor round
enclosure was roofed on top, and the sides were made of a rigid wire mesh with spacing between the wires of
approximately 1” x 1” squares that allowed a predator access to the amazon. Failure to provide a safe primary enclosure
can result in injury and/or death of the birds contained within. Housing facilities for birds must be designed and
constructed for the species of bird housed in them, must be kept in good repair, protect the birds from injury, and restrict
other animals from entering that may negatively affect the welfare of the birds.
Correct by May 01, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.150(a)  Critical
   
Facilities, general. 
The double yellow-headed Amazon was killed since the last inspection on January 25, 2024. The facility representative 
stated that the Amazon was predated upon by a racoon through the enclosure wall or ceiling. The primary outdoor round 
enclosure was roofed on top, and the sides were made of a rigid wire mesh with spacing between the wires of 
approximately 1” x 1” squares that allowed a predator access to the amazon. Failure to provide a safe primary enclosure 
can result in injury and/or death of the birds contained within. Housing facilities for birds must be designed and 
constructed for the species of bird housed in them, must be kept in good repair, protect the birds from injury, and restrict 
other animals from entering that may negatively affect the welfare of the birds. 
Correct by May 01, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
